intro: Astrochlaena involuta, commonly known as the spiral fern, is a member of the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spirally arranged fronds that give it a unique appearance. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with creeping stems that can produce new shoots. Its leaves are typically lanceolate and have a soft, feathery texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
